segments.text: This kitchen view is turning my stomach a little.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is handling that wet plate with her towel.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the sink overflow is just gross—filthy water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's splashing down the fronts of the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And that puddle on the floor looks so unclean and slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in it; ugh, that's nasty.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are adding to the disorder with their cookie grab.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Boy on the stool, hand in the jar—germs from the height?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl reaching up, probably touching who knows what.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: All this in a kitchen meant to be clean—revolting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Even the window to the garden can't freshen this up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they clean it before it gets moldy or worse.
segments.speaker: PAR
